conclusion: The position of a shadow depends on the relative positions of the object and the light source, and shadows shift in the opposite direction when the light source moves.

The size of a shadow can change depending on the angle of the light source relative to the object, and shadows generally become larger when the light source moves closer to being directly behind the object.
Shadow A is cast to the left of the cake.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow A will move to the front left relative to the cake.
The size of shadow A may become slightly larger if the light source moves further away from the cake.
Shadow B is cast to the left of the pen.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow B will shift to the front left of the pen.
The size of shadow B might increase slightly if the light source moves further away.
Shadow C is cast in front of the bandage roll.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow C will shift to the front left of the bandage roll.
The size of shadow C could increase if the light source moves further away.
Shadow D is cast in front of the ring.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow D will shift to the front left of the ring.
The size of shadow D may increase if the light source moves further away.

When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will all shift to the front left of their respective objects, and their sizes may increase slightly if the light source moves further away.
